tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE CustomerAccounts (
    account_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    customer_email VARCHAR(100),
    customer_phone VARCHAR(20),
    account_balance DECIMAL(10, 2),
    last_login TIMESTAMP,
    status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerAccounts (
    account_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    account_balance DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE SupportRepresentatives (
    representative_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    experience_years INT
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerSupportTickets (
    ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    representative_id INT,
    issue_description TEXT,
    ticket_status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerAccounts (
    account_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    email VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE SupportRepresentatives (
    rep_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rep_name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE SupportAccess (
    access_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rep_id INT,
    account_id INT,
    access_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (rep_id) REFERENCES SupportRepresentatives(rep_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (account_id) REFERENCES CustomerAccounts(account_id)
)

CREATE TABLE SupportTickets (
    ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    account_id INT,
    rep_id INT,
    issue_description TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20),
    FOREIGN KEY (account_id) REFERENCES CustomerAccounts(account_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (rep_id) REFERENCES SupportRepresentatives(rep_id)
)

CREATE TABLE CustomerTickets (
	ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	account_id INT,
	rep_id INT,
	created_at TIMESTAMP,
	status VARCHAR(50),
	description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE TicketComments (
	comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	ticket_id INT,
	rep_id INT,
	comment VARCHAR(500),
	created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE TicketAttachments (
	attachment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	ticket_id INT,
	attachment_url VARCHAR(255),
	uploaded_by VARCHAR(100),
	created_at TIMESTAMP
);
